definition: to overlook/to look down from a height
to look down from a height/to spy on sth
bird's-eye view/see also 鳥瞰圖|鸟瞰图[niao3 kan4 tu2]

sentences.english: State-of-the-art fine dining and all-day dining restaurant overlook the skylobby and pool.
sentences.chinese: 艺术和美食餐厅一应而全，俯瞰着空中大堂和泳池。

sentences.english: Visitors at Tongniuling can have a bird's- eye view of the entire development zone.
sentences.chinese: 游客可以在童牛岭俯瞰开发区的全貌。

sentences.english: When to see the earth, everything for it and pleased by the return.
sentences.chinese: 当俯瞰大地时，一切，为之欣然所归。

sentences.english: Massive, granite rock formations overlook beautiful, white-sand beaches.
sentences.chinese: 庞大的花岗岩阵列俯瞰美丽的白色沙滩。

sentences.english: Our apartment is on the sixteenth floor, its window overlooking Daming Lake.
sentences.chinese: 我们的公寓在第十六楼，从窗子里可以俯瞰大明湖。

sentences.english: We lounged in fields of wildflowers, and picnicked on ledges overlooking the sea.
sentences.chinese: 我们俯瞰大海和野花并在利奇斯野餐。

sentences.english: From the top floor tower overlooking the temple.
sentences.chinese: 从振风塔顶层俯瞰寺院。

sentences.english: The Views from the Master Bedroom a goodd Guest room overlook the surf a goodd Maunwoulsua Bay.
sentences.chinese: 主卧室和客房的景观俯瞰毛纳鲁尔湾的浪涛。

sentences.english: Watch the surf from the Triple Twin Room that looks out over Maunaloa Bay.
sentences.chinese: 从俯瞰毛纳路尔湾的三倍双人房观看浪涛。

sentences.english: Japan's Mount Fuji, seen from an airplane, was covered with snow and surrounded by clouds Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 从飞机上俯瞰被积雪和云层覆盖的日本富士山。

sentences.english: One of them was perched up in a tree on the hill overlooking the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 其中一人还爬到了山丘的一棵树上，俯瞰体育场。

sentences.english: The extension has ample glazing, and overlooks a verdant courtyard at the property's centre.
sentences.chinese: 扩展部分有足够的玻璃窗，俯瞰物业中心青翠的庭院。

sentences.english: South livingroom, overlooking the closure of the Terrace Garden.
sentences.chinese: 起居室朝南，封阳台外能俯瞰中央花园。

sentences.english: Japan's Mount Fuji, seen from an airplane, was covered with snow and surrounded.
sentences.chinese: 从飞机上俯瞰被积雪和云层覆盖的日本富士山。

sentences.english: We climbed up the hill to overlook the surrounding wonderful scenery.
sentences.chinese: 我们登上山，俯瞰周围的胜景。

definition: to get a bird's-eye view/bird's-eye view/broad overview
to take in the whole scene at once/to have a panoramic view
to survey the scene from an elevated position
as far as the eye can see
to gaze afar/to look into the distance
tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
to look intensively/to feast one's eyes on
to look up at/to look up to sb hopefully
